title: Police: Men strong-armed Boston shoppers into giving donations, then charged them thousands
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Boston police say the men pressured their alleged victims into giving money by claiming to be collecting donations for an injured child or a recently deceased brother.

By Abby Patkin September 19, 2025 | 4:59 PM 2 minutes to read Boston police are seeking the public’s help identifying three men who allegedly cornered people outside stores Saturday and stole thousands of dollars from them under the guise of soliciting much smaller charitable donations.

In each of the incidents, Boston police say the men pressured their alleged victims into giving money by credit card, either claiming to be collecting donations for a child who had been shot or a recently deceased brother.
